intro: Murdannia malabarica var. terminalis, commonly known as the Malabar murdannia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of India. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
